title: Homemade Masala Dosa
description: A delicious South Indian breakfast dish.

instructions.text: Soak rice and urad dal overnight.
Grind to make a batter and ferment.

title: Medu Vada (Savory Lentil Donuts)
description: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside South Indian lentil fritters.

instructions.text: Soak urad dal for 2 hours. Drain well.
Grind dal to a thick, fluffy batter with minimal water.
Mix in onion, chilies, ginger, curry leaves, salt, pepper.
Wet hands, shape batter into donut shapes (with a hole in the center).
Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.

title: Kerala Style Fish Curry (Meen Curry)
description: A tangy and spicy fish curry cooked in coconut milk, typical of Kerala cuisine.

instructions.text: Soak kudampuli in warm water.
Sauté shallots, ginger, garlic, green chilies.
Add spice powders (chili, turmeric, coriander). Sauté briefly.
Add thin coconut milk, soaked kudampuli, salt. Bring to a simmer.
Add fish pieces, cook until done. Finish with thick coconut milk and curry leaves tempering.

title: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A flavorful Karnataka dish made with rice, lentils, vegetables, and a special spice powder.

instructions.text: Cook rice and dal together until mushy.
Cook vegetables separately until tender.
Mix cooked rice/dal, vegetables, tamarind pulp, Bisi Bele Bath powder, salt, jaggery.
Add water to adjust consistency, simmer for 10 minutes.
Prepare tempering (ghee, mustard seeds, curry leaves, cashews) and add to the dish.

title: Pesarattu (Green Moong Dal Dosa)
description: A healthy dosa variation made from green moong dal, popular in Andhra Pradesh.

instructions.text: Soak green moong dal and rice overnight or for 6-8 hours.
Grind soaked dal, rice, ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, salt to a smooth batter (add water as needed).
Optionally mix in finely chopped onions.
Heat a tawa (griddle), pour a ladleful of batter, and spread thinly like a dosa.
Drizzle oil/ghee, cook until crisp and golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

title: Avial (Mixed Vegetable Coconut Stew)
description: A traditional Kerala dish with mixed vegetables cooked in a coconut-yogurt base.

instructions.text: Cut vegetables into thick, long strips.
Cook vegetables with turmeric powder and salt until just tender (don't overcook).
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds to a coarse paste.
Add coconut paste to cooked vegetables, mix well, cook for 2 minutes.
Whisk yogurt and add it to the mixture. Heat gently (don't boil). Finish with coconut oil and curry leaves.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: The ultimate classic cookie, soft and chewy with plenty of chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream butter and sugars together until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to wet ingredients.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9-12 minutes.

title: Homemade Pizza Dough
description: A basic recipe for making your own pizza crust from scratch.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and olive oil.
Mix until a dough forms. Knead on a floured surface for 5-7 minutes until smooth.
Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place for 1-1.5 hours, or until doubled.
Punch down dough, divide if needed, and shape for pizza.

title: Classic Scones
description: Light and tender British scones, perfect served with jam and clotted cream.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in cold butter using a pastry blender or fingers until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
In a small bowl, whisk milk and egg. Add to dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface, pat to 1-inch thickness. Cut out rounds with a cutter.
Place on baking sheet, brush tops with milk. Bake for 12-15 minutes.

title: Fudgy Brownies
description: Rich, dense, and intensely chocolatey brownies.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and flour an 8x8 inch pan.
Melt butter. Remove from heat, stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
Whisk in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder (if using).
Pour batter into prepared pan. Optional: stir in chocolate chips or nuts.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out with moist crumbs.
Let cool completely before cutting.

title: Simple White Bread Loaf
description: A basic recipe for a soft, homemade white bread loaf.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast and 1 tsp sugar in warm water. Let proof for 5-10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine remaining sugar, salt, oil, and proofed yeast mixture.
Gradually add flour, mixing until dough comes together. Knead for 6-8 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, cover, let rise until doubled (about 1 hour).
Punch down dough, shape into a loaf, place in greased loaf pan. Let rise again until doubled (about 30-45 mins).
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

title: Black Bean and Corn Salsa Salad
description: A quick, vibrant salad or dip that's perfect for potlucks or a light lunch.

instructions.text: Combine black beans, corn, red onion, and red bell pepper in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the bean and corn mixture. Stir in chopped cilantro.
Chill for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Serve as a salad or with tortilla chips.

title: Speedy Tuna Melts
description: Classic comfort food: creamy tuna salad on toast topped with melted cheese.

instructions.text: In a bowl, mix tuna, mayonnaise, celery, salt, and pepper.
Toast bread slices lightly.
Spread tuna mixture evenly over two slices of toast.
Top with cheese slices.
Broil or toast in a toaster oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: 20-Minute Lemon Butter Pan-Seared Salmon
description: Flaky salmon cooked quickly in a delicious lemon butter sauce.

instructions.text: Pat salmon fillets dry, season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place salmon skin-side down (if using skin) and cook for 4-6 minutes until crispy.
Flip salmon, reduce heat to medium. Add butter to the pan.
Once butter melts, add garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
Stir in lemon juice and parsley. Baste salmon with the sauce. Cook for another 2-4 minutes until salmon is cooked through.

title: Quick Veggie Quesadillas
description: Cheesy quesadillas filled with vegetables, ready in minutes.

instructions.text: Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle half of it with cheese, beans, corn, and bell pepper.
Fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling.
Cook for 2-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cheese is melted.
Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa or sour cream.

title: Grown-Up Grilled Cheese
description: An elevated grilled cheese sandwich with gourmet cheeses and additions.

ingredients.name: Optional: Fig Jam, Bacon, Caramelized Onions

instructions.text: Butter one side of each bread slice.
Place one slice butter-side down in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat.
Layer cheeses (and optional additions) on the bread in the skillet.
Top with the second bread slice, butter-side up.
Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, until bread is golden brown and cheese is melted and gooey.

title: Green Detox Smoothie
description: A healthy and energizing smoothie packed with greens and fruits.

ingredients.name: Optional: Chia Seeds, Ginger, Lemon Juice

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until very smooth, adding more liquid if needed.
Serve immediately.

title: Classic Hot Chocolate
description: Rich and creamy homemade hot chocolate.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan, whisk together cocoa powder, sugar, and a splash of milk to form a paste.
Gradually whisk in the remaining milk.
Heat over medium-low heat, whisking occasionally, until hot (do not boil).
If using chocolate chips, add them and whisk until melted and smooth.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla extract. Serve immediately, optionally topped with whipped cream or marshmallows.

title: Agua Fresca (Cucumber Lime)
description: A light and refreshing Mexican fruit water.

instructions.text: Combine chopped cucumber and 2 cups of water in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher, pressing solids to extract liquid.
Discard solids. Stir in the remaining 2 cups of water, lime juice, and sweetener (if using) into the pitcher.
Chill thoroughly. Serve over ice, garnished with lime slices or mint.

title: Simple Iced Coffee
description: Easy homemade iced coffee.

instructions.text: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour chilled strong coffee over the ice, leaving some room at the top.
Add milk or cream to taste.
Stir in sweetener if desired.

title: Orange Creamsicle Smoothie
description: A creamy smoothie reminiscent of the classic popsicle.

instructions.text: Combine orange juice, yogurt/ice cream, frozen banana (if using), orange zest, and ice cubes in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Serve immediately.

title: One-Pan Roasted Sausage and Root Vegetables
description: A simple and flavorful meal with sausage and seasonal root vegetables roasted together.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut sausage into 1-inch pieces.
On a large baking sheet, toss sausage, sweet potatoes, carrots, and onion with olive oil, salt, pepper, and desired herbs (like rosemary or thyme).
Spread everything in a single layer.
Roast for 35-45 minutes, flipping halfway through, until vegetables are tender and sausage is browned.

title: One-Pot Greek Lemon Chicken and Orzo
description: A bright and flavorful dish with chicken, orzo pasta, and Greek seasonings.

instructions.text: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces, season with salt, pepper, oregano.
Sear chicken in a large pot or Dutch oven until lightly browned. Remove chicken.
Add garlic, sauté briefly. Add orzo, toast for 1 minute.
Stir in chicken broth and lemon juice. Bring to a boil.
Return chicken to the pot. Reduce heat, cover, simmer until orzo is cooked and liquid is mostly absorbed (about 15-20 mins).
Stir in spinach until wilted. Top with feta cheese before serving.

title: One-Pan Spanish Chicken and Rice (Arroz con Pollo)
description: A simplified version of the classic Spanish dish, cooked in one pan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season chicken thighs. Sear skin-side down in an oven-safe skillet until crispy. Remove chicken.
Sauté onion and bell pepper in the same skillet.
Add garlic, paprika, rice. Toast rice briefly.
Stir in broth (infused with saffron if using), diced tomatoes, peas. Bring to a simmer.
Nestle chicken thighs back into the rice mixture. Transfer skillet to oven, bake covered for 20 mins, then uncovered for 15-20 mins until rice is cooked and chicken is done.

title: One-Pot Jambalaya
description: A flavorful Creole rice dish with sausage, chicken (optional), and shrimp cooked together.

ingredients.name: Onion, Celery, Bell Pepper (Holy Trinity, Chopped)

instructions.text: Brown sausage (and chicken if using) in a large Dutch oven. Remove meat.
Sauté onion, celery, and bell pepper until softened.
Add garlic, Cajun/Creole seasoning, rice. Toast rice.
Stir in broth, diced tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce. Return sausage/chicken to pot.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, simmer for 20-25 minutes until rice is almost cooked.
Stir in shrimp, cover, cook for another 5-7 minutes until shrimp are pink and cooked through. Fluff rice before serving.

title: One-Pot Mushroom Stroganoff
description: A creamy, savory mushroom and noodle dish cooked in a single pot.

instructions.text: Sauté mushrooms and onions in butter or oil in a large pot until browned and softened.
Add garlic, paprika, thyme. Cook for 1 minute.
Stir in vegetable broth, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce (optional), salt, pepper, and egg noodles.
Bring to a simmer, cover, cook until noodles are tender (about 10-12 minutes), stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream or Greek yogurt and fresh parsley.

title: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A creamy, velvety soup made from roasted butternut squash.

instructions.text: Peel, seed, and cube butternut squash. Chop onion and apple.
Roast squash cubes until tender OR sauté onion, apple, and squash in a pot.
Add vegetable broth, sage/thyme, salt, pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook until squash is very tender.
Carefully blend the soup using an immersion blender or regular blender until smooth.
Return to pot, stir in cream/coconut milk (if using). Heat gently. Adjust seasoning.

title: Classic Beef Stew
description: A hearty and comforting stew with tender beef and vegetables in a rich gravy.

instructions.text: Toss beef cubes with flour, salt, and pepper.
Brown beef in batches in a large pot or Dutch oven. Remove beef.
Sauté onion, carrots, celery until softened.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Deglaze with red wine or broth.
Return beef to pot. Add broth, bay leaf, thyme. Bring to a simmer, cover, cook on low for 1.5 hours.
Add potatoes, continue simmering until beef and potatoes are tender (about 30-45 more minutes).

title: Minestrone Soup
description: A thick Italian soup packed with vegetables, beans, and pasta.

instructions.text: Sauté onion, carrots, and celery in olive oil in a large pot.
Add garlic, zucchini, green beans. Cook for a few more minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, kidney beans, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Add pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente.
Optional: Stir in spinach or kale until wilted. Serve topped with Parmesan cheese.

title: Creamy Mushroom Soup
description: A rich and elegant soup made with fresh mushrooms.

instructions.text: Melt butter in a pot. Sauté onions until soft.
Add mushrooms and cook until browned and liquid has evaporated.
Stir in garlic and thyme. Cook for 1 minute.
Pour in vegetable broth, bring to a simmer, cook for 15 minutes.
Blend part or all of the soup until smooth (using immersion or regular blender).
Return to pot, stir in heavy cream. Heat gently. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Spicy Black Bean Soup
description: A flavorful and hearty soup with black beans and a touch of spice.

instructions.text: Sauté onion and garlic in a pot until softened.
Stir in cumin, chili powder, oregano.
Add black beans and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Cook for 15-20 minutes.
Optional: Blend about 1-2 cups of the soup to make it creamier, then return to the pot.
Adjust seasoning, serve hot with desired toppings.
